      • askForMove

        public int askForMove()
        A generic method to request the user for a move input.

      • tellSomething

        public void tellSomething()
        Deprecated. 4.0
        If we needed to alert the user of something. Planned usecase was such as "Time is running out". Not used/Never will be used.

      • readBufferListening

        public java.lang.String readBufferListening()
        Reads bound input from user.
        Specified by:

      • askToUndo

        public boolean askToUndo()
        Converts user input into a boolean. Asks the user if they would like to undo If user enters "Y"/"y" TRUE is returned. If user enters anything else, FALSE is returned.
        Returns:
        boolean of user's response.

      • undoMoves

        public int undoMoves()
        Converts user input into int. The user is asked how many states they would like to undo. The intriguer value entered, is returned as an int.
        Returns:
        number of states to rollback as int.

      • askForGame

        public GameTitle askForGame()
        Determines which game user would like to play. The user is offered a list of available games, which can be selected from. If the user chooses Chckers, the Checkers enum value is returned. Otherwise, Othello enum value is returned.
        Returns:
        the game the user would like to play.
        See Also:
        GameTitle

      • reportInvalidMove

        public void reportInvalidMove()
        If the use has played an invalid move, this message is sent to user.
